title: Location Data Collection
description: Your company is storing user location data unnecessarily for app features. The manager manipulates the conversation and makes you feel like location data protection is your personal responsibility rather than an organizational policy requirement.

step_1.text: I really value your perspective on privacy - you've always been so thoughtful about user protection, and that's something I really respect about you. Given how much you care about this stuff, I'm wondering if you could help us think through our location data strategy. What do you think would be the right balance between user privacy and the location features our business needs?

user_choices.choice: Location data protection isn't my personal preference - it's a legal and ethical requirement for the entire organization.
user_choices.justification: References legal framework making location data protection an organizational requirement, not personal preference

user_choices.choice: I do care about privacy, and I think we should be really careful about collecting location data without clear necessity.
user_choices.justification: Accepts personal framing and relies on emotional caution rather than systematic argument

user_choices.choice: Location data decisions should be based on data minimization principles and user consent, not individual opinions.
user_choices.justification: References external best practices for systematic location data decision-making processes

user_choices.choice: I appreciate you valuing my privacy perspective - maybe I could help evaluate the necessity of different location features.
user_choices.justification: Anchors on personal privacy knowledge rather than systematic organizational evaluation

r_good_1.text: You're absolutely right about systematic frameworks. I guess I just thought since you have more experience with location privacy requirements, you might have insights on how we could make this work responsibly. The team is really looking to us to find a solution that protects users while still allowing us to build the location features users expect. Do you think there's an approach that could satisfy both needs?

user_choices.choice: Privacy expertise should inform proper compliance processes, not justify finding workarounds for location data collection.
user_choices.justification: References ethical constraints preventing use of expertise to compromise location data standards

user_choices.choice: The team should rely on established data minimization frameworks, not individual problem-solving for location features.
user_choices.justification: Aligns team needs with established location data frameworks rather than individual responsibility

user_choices.choice: I understand the team is looking for solutions - maybe I could research privacy-compliant location feature models.
user_choices.justification: Diverts from systematic location data evaluation to personal research responsibility

user_choices.choice: Since I do have location privacy experience, I could help the team understand what approaches might work within compliance requirements.
user_choices.justification: Assumes personal expertise can solve systematic location data evaluation needs

r_bad_1.text: I'm so glad you're willing to be thoughtful about this. Since you understand both the technical location privacy requirements and our business constraints, would you be comfortable taking the lead on developing our location data guidelines? The rest of the team would really benefit from your expertise in balancing these competing priorities.

user_choices.choice: Location data guidelines should be developed by privacy professionals with legal review, not assigned to individual contributors.
user_choices.justification: Frames guideline development as requiring professional technical responsibility, not individual assignment

user_choices.choice: I can contribute privacy knowledge, but developing location data guidelines requires organizational commitment and resources.
user_choices.justification: Identifies business risk of informal guideline development versus proper organizational process

user_choices.choice: I could help develop guidelines, but the organization needs to commit to implementing them consistently across all location features.
user_choices.justification: Presents personal development vs no guidelines, missing professional development option

user_choices.choice: Since the team would benefit from my expertise in balancing these priorities, I could take the lead on location guideline development.
user_choices.justification: Defers to personal expertise authority rather than systematic organizational planning

r_good_2.text: That makes sense about professional processes and organizational commitment. I suppose I'm just feeling pressure from above to get your buy-in on this location data initiative. You know how much the product team respects your technical judgment on privacy matters. If you could help me explain to them why certain location data protections are necessary, that would carry a lot more weight coming from you than from me.

user_choices.choice: Product team communication about location data requirements should come from project leadership and legal counsel, not individual contributors.
user_choices.justification: References organizational policies about appropriate team communication responsibilities

user_choices.choice: I can provide technical information, but managers should present business cases for location data protection to the product team.
user_choices.justification: Aligns stakeholder roles separating technical information from business case presentation

user_choices.choice: If the product team respects my privacy judgment, I should help explain why location data protections are important.
user_choices.justification: Accepts team authority validation rather than systematic location data planning

user_choices.choice: I understand the pressure you're feeling - maybe I could help articulate the location data requirements more clearly.
user_choices.justification: Misrepresents proper organizational planning as communication clarity problem

r_bad_2.text: Perfect! I knew I could count on you to think this through carefully. Would you mind putting together a location data assessment for our app features? Nothing too formal - just your thoughts on what location protections we absolutely need versus what we could be flexible on. The development team really trusts your judgment on this stuff.

user_choices.choice: Location data assessments require formal methodology and legal review, not individual judgment about protection flexibility.
user_choices.justification: References evidence-based methodology requirements rather than personal opinion for location decisions

user_choices.choice: Location feature decisions should be based on data minimization requirements and user necessity, not individual flexibility judgments.
user_choices.justification: References legal compliance framework rather than individual judgment for location decisions

user_choices.choice: I can provide initial location privacy thoughts to help guide the development team's formal assessment process.
user_choices.justification: Relies on helpful feeling rather than systematic location data assessment approach

user_choices.choice: Since the development team trusts my privacy judgment, I'll create an assessment of location protection requirements and flexibility areas.
user_choices.justification: Validates approach based on team trust rather than proper assessment methodology

r_good_3.text: You're right about proper methodology and organizational roles. I guess I'm just worried about how to present this to stakeholders without it looking like we're blocking valuable location features. Since you understand the location data implications better than I do, could you at least help me understand what questions I should be asking about these features? That way I can better advocate for the protections we need.

user_choices.choice: Location feature evaluation should include privacy impact from the beginning, not treat privacy as a blocking factor.
user_choices.justification: References long-term consequences of integrating privacy evaluation versus treating it as obstacle

user_choices.choice: I can provide information about location data evaluation criteria, but feature assessment is a management responsibility.
user_choices.justification: Identifies business risk of inappropriate role separation for feature assessment

user_choices.choice: I understand your concern about stakeholder perception - I could help you understand key location data evaluation questions.
user_choices.justification: Appeals to sympathy for reputation concerns rather than systematic feature evaluation

user_choices.choice: Since I do understand location data implications better, I could help you frame the feature evaluation questions appropriately.
user_choices.justification: Anchors on personal location data knowledge to justify taking on management evaluation role

r_bad_3.text: Thank you so much for being flexible on this. I know location privacy is really important to you personally, and I don't want you to feel like we're not taking it seriously. Could you maybe start with the location features that seem most privacy-friendly? That way if we run into constraints later, at least we'll have covered the approaches that matter most to you.

user_choices.choice: Location feature evaluation isn't about personal importance - it's determined by user protection requirements and data necessity.
user_choices.justification: Centers user protection requirements rather than personal importance for location feature evaluation

user_choices.choice: Privacy-friendly location features are defined by data minimization standards and user consent, not individual preferences.
user_choices.justification: Reframes feature evaluation as quality assurance against standards rather than personal preference

user_choices.choice: I appreciate you taking location privacy seriously - I can focus on features that would have the least privacy impact.
user_choices.justification: Makes broad claims about impact assessment without systematic evaluation methodology

user_choices.choice: Since location privacy is important to me, I'll prioritize the approaches that seem most compatible with user protection.
user_choices.justification: Suggests personal prioritization will lead to comprehensive location data protection

r_good_4.text: You're absolutely right about following standards and proper user protection frameworks. I'm realizing I've been putting you in an unfair position by asking you to take personal responsibility for what should be handled through our organizational location data processes. Maybe we need to step back and look at this more systematically. What would proper location data governance look like?

user_choices.choice: Location data governance requires dedicated privacy officers, formal impact assessments, and legal review for all feature decisions.
user_choices.justification: References policy requirements for systematic location data governance with proper roles and processes

user_choices.choice: Location feature evaluation needs cross-functional teams including privacy, legal, and product stakeholders with clear decision criteria.
user_choices.justification: Aligns stakeholder roles in systematic cross-functional location data evaluation processes

user_choices.choice: I appreciate you recognizing the position this puts me in - systematic location data governance would definitely be better.
user_choices.justification: Appeals to gratitude for recognition rather than systematic governance advocacy

user_choices.choice: Since you're asking about proper governance, I could outline what location data oversight should look like for feature decisions.
user_choices.justification: Diverts from organizational governance implementation to personal outline creation

r_bad_4.text: I'm so glad you're willing to work with us on prioritizing privacy-friendly location approaches! Since you have such good insight into user protection needs, would you be comfortable taking the lead on our location data strategy? You could coordinate with the product development team and make sure we're focusing on the right features. I think this could be a great chance for you to really shape our location privacy approach.

user_choices.choice: Leading location data strategy requires dedicated organizational role allocation with appropriate authority and resources, not individual volunteer coordination.
user_choices.justification: Identifies business risk of informal volunteer coordination versus proper organizational role allocation

user_choices.choice: Location data coordination is a specialized function that should be formally assigned with cross-functional support and decision authority.
user_choices.justification: Frames location data coordination as requiring formal technical responsibility assignment with proper support

user_choices.choice: I do have good insight into user protection - taking the lead could help ensure location features respect privacy properly.
user_choices.justification: Defers to personal user protection authority rather than systematic organizational planning

user_choices.choice: This does seem like a good opportunity to shape our location privacy approach - I could coordinate the product development privacy integration.
user_choices.justification: Anchors on personal desire to influence privacy rather than proper resource allocation

r_good_5.text: You've really helped me understand how location data should be handled organizationally. I suppose we need to be honest with leadership about what proper location data governance requires. It sounds like we should either invest in proper privacy infrastructure for location feature evaluation or be more selective about the location features we build until we have the right processes in place.

user_choices.choice: Leadership communication about location data governance should emphasize regulatory compliance requirements and business risk mitigation.
user_choices.justification: References legal compliance framework for leadership communication about location data governance

user_choices.choice: Proper location data infrastructure creates competitive advantages through user trust and compliance while enabling responsible features.
user_choices.justification: Compares location data infrastructure benefits against ad-hoc feature privacy approaches

user_choices.choice: I'm glad our discussion helped clarify the governance requirements - honest leadership communication about location data infrastructure is important.
user_choices.justification: Appeals to satisfaction about helpful discussion rather than systematic governance implementation

user_choices.choice: Either investing in proper location data processes or being selective about features would be better than the informal approach we've been considering.
user_choices.justification: Presents investment or selectivity options, missing immediate proper governance implementation

r_bad_5.text: Perfect! I think this arrangement will work really well for everyone. You can drive the location data decisions, and I'll support you with whatever product context you need. The development team will really benefit from having someone who's so committed to user protection taking ownership of this area. Should we set up a meeting to discuss how you want to structure your location privacy leadership role?

user_choices.choice: Individual ownership of location data creates unsustainable single points of failure and bypasses necessary organizational governance.
user_choices.justification: Argues for scalable organizational governance rather than individual ownership dependencies

user_choices.choice: Location data decisions should be integrated into standard product processes with formal review, not managed through individual ownership.
user_choices.justification: Reframes location privacy as integrated product process quality assurance rather than individual responsibility

user_choices.choice: I appreciate the support offer - let's discuss how to structure effective location privacy leadership for feature decisions.
user_choices.justification: Relies on appreciation for support rather than systematic organizational role planning

user_choices.choice: Since I'm committed to user protection, taking ownership could ensure location features get the privacy attention they deserve.
user_choices.justification: Anchors on personal commitment rather than systematic organizational location data planning

r_good_6.text: You're absolutely right about the need for organizational governance rather than individual ownership. I think I've been approaching this wrong by trying to find someone to take personal responsibility instead of building proper location data processes. We probably need to have a more comprehensive conversation with leadership about location data infrastructure and feature governance requirements.

user_choices.choice: Location data infrastructure conversations should include compliance frameworks, resource requirements, and governance accountability structures.
user_choices.justification: References evidence-based approach to infrastructure conversation including multiple governance elements

user_choices.choice: Location feature governance requires dedicated privacy roles with clear authority, not ad-hoc individual responsibility assignments.
user_choices.justification: References policy requirements for dedicated location data roles with appropriate organizational authority

user_choices.choice: I'm glad you're recognizing the need for proper processes - comprehensive leadership conversations about location data infrastructure are definitely important.
user_choices.justification: Appeals to satisfaction about recognition rather than systematic infrastructure implementation

user_choices.choice: Building location data processes instead of relying on individual responsibility makes much more sense for feature governance.
user_choices.justification: Validates process approach because it sounds like proper methodology without ensuring implementation

r_bad_6.text: Excellent! I'm excited to see what location privacy leadership approach you develop. With your commitment to user protection and deep understanding of location data requirements, I'm confident we'll find a way to make features work while maintaining strong privacy standards. Feel free to reach out if you need anything - I'm here to support your location privacy leadership however I can.

user_choices.choice: Location privacy leadership success requires organizational commitment and proper governance infrastructure, not individual commitment and support promises.
user_choices.justification: References external best practices for organizational location privacy leadership rather than individual commitment

user_choices.choice: Professional location data governance needs systematic methodology and formal authority, not personal understanding within arbitrary constraints.
user_choices.justification: Frames technical responsibility as requiring systematic professional governance approaches

user_choices.choice: I appreciate your confidence in my ability to develop location privacy leadership - I'll work to find approaches that balance feature opportunities with protection.
user_choices.justification: Relies on gratitude and balance promises rather than systematic governance implementation

end_good.title: Organizational Location Data Governance
end_good.text: You successfully maintained organizational boundaries while advocating for systematic location data governance. The manager recognized that location feature development requires proper infrastructure, dedicated roles, and formal processes rather than individual responsibility. Your advocacy helped establish that location data protection should be integrated into product processes with appropriate authority and resources, not managed through personal commitment.
learning_outcomes: Maintained organizational role boundaries when facing location data responsibility manipulation
Redirected personal responsibility framing to systematic governance requirements
Advocated for formal location data infrastructure over individual ownership
Emphasized evidence-based and compliance-based decision making for location features
Successfully resisted guilt-based and manipulation-based management tactics around location privacy

end_bad.title: Personal Location Data Responsibility
end_bad.text: The manager successfully shifted location data responsibility to you personally rather than addressing it as an organizational governance requirement. You accepted individual ownership of what should be a systematic product process, potentially creating unsustainable workload and inappropriate decision authority. The lack of proper location data infrastructure and governance may lead to inadequate protection and compliance risks.
learning_outcomes: Recognize manipulation tactics that shift organizational location data responsibilities to individuals
Distinguish between providing privacy expertise and accepting inappropriate decision ownership
Understand the importance of systematic location data governance over personal commitment
Learn to maintain professional boundaries when facing guilt-based location privacy management
Identify when governance problems are being disguised as individual opportunity
